page.title: 18EDUCATION TODAY: DUNDONALD
page.content: Children in the village of Dundonald begin their school career at the local Primary School when they are five years old. After seven years they will have to travel to the nearby town of Troon to continue their education at the local secondary school, Marr College. The present Dundonald Primary School was built in 1897 but as the population of the village increased, additions and improvements have been made in the way of new classrooms,a modern kitchen and a gymnasium. The present number of pupils is about 324 but this number is slowly dropping year by year and the number of classes and teachers becoming less.It is a fact that there are now more pensioners in the village than children of primary school age!
